reviews.review_msg: Dr. Panchasi is a very casual and down to Earth prof. Her ability to account for the needs of students (even outside of the Covid crisis) is a blessing to say the least. She always puts in a lot of effort to make her lectures and assignments creative and interesting. A lenient grader, its hard to do bad in her courses. Highly recommended to take
She was a really engaging lecturer. Make sure you show up for class and participate! Hard marker, and she doesn't do tests, so you need to be a good writer to do well.

Lots of writing, quiz every class RIGHT at the start so not allowed to come late, lots of reading (80 pages min each class) that the quizzes are on, sometimes 300 pages of reading, lectures are boring -captive audience-. She's super passionate but talks like a machine gun so you lose interest. Basically the class was just too much work.

She makes you work hard for your grade, but she is a great teacher! She is very knowledgeable and you can tell how much work goes into her lectures. She is more than willing to help people who ask, don't know why I stayed intimidated for so long. I ended up doing well and am glad I took the course. Learned a lot.

Roxanne is by far the best hist professor I have ever or will ever have at SFU. She was so interested in the subject and put so much of herself into the class. The final essay was completely reasonable and she was more than glad to help. I will go out of my way to take a class with her again.

This class was great! The quizzes were quite difficult at times as they were based on specific information from the textbook, but they weren't worth much. Paper topics were very fair and straightforward. I would recommend going to her office hours as she gives you extra feedback and clarification on how to improve your essays.

Roxanne is amazing! I highly recommend her! She is genuinely passionate about history and very charismatic/funny. She is also a kind person and thinks about her students. For example, she let us redo a quiz because the class average was low. She also would extend deadlines.

This is a great class if you're taking a third year class for the first time.  she really preps you for the final research papers and is really nice and helpful.  Participation is greatly expected and there is a lot of reading (as is with every hist class);  Also is a writing intensive class.  I would recommend.
No Comments
Great prof, very friendly and helpful. lectures are a little disorganized, but that's ok. She's always willing to help; she wants students to come see her. She's pretty cute too!
Extremely nice prof, witty, enjoyed the class lectures immensely, & the self-deprecating humour. But be prepared to work, lots of reading & assignments. Would recommend.

A very intensive workload, which is doable if one keeps up with the work. The marking was not, overall, too bad, but it was done in a picky manner. She does appear willing to help students out if they need it. However, her downside is the disorganiztion associated with the lectures.

She is a great prof, passionate about what she teaches. She is very clear about what she wants, and her lectures are fantastic. Take her if you really wanna learn something about the French nation. There were too many essays...4 total and weekly responses...but overall a very good class.

WICKED LADY.  So easy to talk with.  Very passionate about her career.  Hard marker, but fair.  Different style of lectures, but if you're more of a go to class and "put off" the text books kind of person then this class is totally for you.  Great style.
The most intellectual comment I can produce is w00t
I thoroughly appreciated Roxanne's effort to introduce the class to the more obscure and ambiguous issues in French history.  A well-organized and engaging speaker with excellent fashion sense.

History majors listen up! Incredibly refreshing approach to history. Very, very fair marker; you have ample time to master subject matter before writing on it, plus she will be glad to help. Subject matter is actually interesting as well. Totally cute too
A great professor, more than that a great person

This was a writting intensive course and as a result there was no exams but 3 essays and a written piece everyweek. Very helpful and makes class interesting. Not a regergitation course for a change! from a 3.77 student
No Comments
really nice teacher.  NO EXAMS,but a lot of written work which is not too hard.  really clear and fun lectures.  would highly recommend.
really good teacher, no exams, mostly papers and really interesting class. would recommend this class to anyone. By the way, she is HOT!
Roxanne is awesome! For me personally, however, he teaching style is a little progressive, and needs to be a bit more grounded in the material.
A great prof and a great person
Great prof; friendly, approachable, fair, interesting lectures
